otherInsuredLastName.description: The primary policyholder's last name or organizational name.

otherInsuredFirstName.description: The primary policyholder's first name, if they are an individual.

otherInsuredMiddleName.description: The primary policyholder's middle name or initial, if they are an individual.

otherInsuredNameSuffix.description: The primary policyholder's name suffix, such as Jr. or III.

otherInsuredAdditionalIdentifier.description: The primary policyholder's Social Security Number. The Social Security Number must be a string of exactly nine numbers with no separators. For example `123456789`.

claims.description: Status information for the claim or service line.

PatientClaimStatusDetailsDependent.description: Information about a dependent who received services related to the claim.

lastName.description: The last name of the dependent. Can be up to 60 characters.

firstName.description: The first name of the dependent. Can be up to 35 characters.

middleName.description: The middle name or initial of the dependent. Can be up to 25 characters.

suffix.description: The suffix of the dependent, such as Jr or III. Can be up to 10 characters.

PatientClaimStatusDetailsSubscriber.description: Information about the primary policy holder for the health plan.

organizationName.description: The subscriber's business name. Applicable when an employer submitted a worker's compensation claim, or other situations when an employer is the subscriber.

lastName.description: The last name of the subscriber. Can be up to 60 characters.

firstName.description: The first name of the subscriber. Can be up to 35 characters.

middleName.description: The middle name or initial of the subscriber. Can be up to 25 characters.

suffix.description: The suffix of the subscriber, such as Jr or III. Can be up to 10 characters.

memberId.description: The subscriber's member ID for their health plan.

employerIdentificationNumber.description: The subscriber's employer identification number. This may be used in conjunction with a worker's compensation claim.

PatientConditionDescription1.description: A description of the patient's condition.

PatientConditionInformationVision.description: Required on vision claims involving replacement lenses or frames when this information is known to impact reimbursement. .

conditionCodes.description: Code indicating the reason for the vision services. Visit [Claim code lists](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/claims-code-lists#vision-condition-codes) for a complete list.

PatientConditionInformationVisionCertifi.description: Code indicating whether there is a certification. Can be set to `N` - No or `Y` - Yes.

PatientConditionInformationVisionConditi.description: Code indicating the reason for the vision services. Visit [Claims code lists](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/claims-code-lists#vision-condition-codes) for a complete list.

patientReasonForVisitCode.description: The patient's reason for visit code. It must be a valid code from the appropriate coding system. **Do not** submit the decimal for ICD codes; the decimal is implied. Also, **do not** submit IDC-10 header codes. Header codes exist to group related codes and are not valid for billing. These header codes can change with each new version of ICD-10, so we recommend reviewing your diagnosis codes every year to ensure that they aren't classified as header codes in the most recent version. To determine whether a code is a header code, you can also search the [Value Set Authority Center](https://vsac.nlm.nih.gov/context/cs). If the 'Header' property is set, the code is a header code and you shouldn't use it in claim submissions.

PatientReasonForVisitQualifierCode.description: Code identifying the type of reason for visit code used. Can be set to `APR` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification Patient's Reason for Visit or `PR` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification Patient's Reason for Visit. Note that ICD-9 is deprecated and cannot be used in new claims.

PayToAddressName.description: Use when the address for payment is different than that of the billing provider for this claim.

address.description: The address information.

PayToAddressNameEntityTypeQualifier.description: Code identifying the type of entity. Can be set to `2` - Non-Person Entity.

PayToPlan.description: Use for subrogation payment requests. If you include this information, you must also set the `claimInformation.otherSubscriberInformation.payerPaidAmount` to the amount the payer (for example, Medicaid) actually paid.

organizationName.description: The last name of the individual, or the business name of the pay-to-plan organization.

address.description: The address of the pay-to-plan organization.

secondaryIdentifier.description: The secondary identifier you specified in `secondaryIdentifierTypeCode`.

taxIdentificationNumber.description: The Employer Identification Number (EIN). This must be a string of exactly nine numbers with no separators.

PayToPlanName.description: Use for subrogation payment requests. If you include this information, you must also set the `claimInformation.otherSubscriberInformation.payerPaidAmount` to the amount the payer (for example, Medicaid) actually paid.

address.description: Specify the location of the named party.

organizationName.description: The business name of the organization to which the payment should be made.

identificationCode.description: The identification code specified by the `identificationCodeQualifier`.

payerIdentificationNumber.description: The payer identification number. You should only include this information when the `identificationCodeQualifier` is set to `XV` - Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services PlanID.

taxId.description: The payer tax identification number (TIN). This is a unique number assigned to the payer by the IRS.

naic.description: The National Association of Insurance Commisioners (NAIC) code. This is the five-digit identifier assigned to each insurance company.

PayToPlanNameIdentificationCodeQualifier.description: The type of identification code used to identify the organization. Can be set to `PI` - Payer Identification or `XV` - Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services PlanID. Use `XV` when reporting the Health Plan ID (HPID) or Other Entity Identifier (OEID).

Payee.description: Information about the provider receiving the payment.

name.description: The payee's name. This can be the name of an individual or an organization.

taxId.description: The payee's Federal Tax Identification Number (TIN).

centersForMedicareAndMedicaidServicesPla.description: The payee's Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) Plan ID. This used to report the Health Plan ID (HPID) or Other Entity Identifier (OEID).

npi.description: The payee's National Provider Identifier (NPI).

nationalCouncilForPrescriptionDrugProgra.description: The payee's National Council for Prescription Drugs Pharmacy Number.

payeeIdentification.description: Other information necessary to identify the payee.

federalTaxPayersIdentificationNumber.description: The payee's Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number (when the payee is a business) or the payee's social security number (when the payee is an individual provider).

address1.description: The first line of the address.

address2.description: The second line of the address.

city.description: The city where the address is located.

state.description: The standard code for the state or province. For example `PA` for Pennsylvania.

postalCode.description: The postal code for the address, excluding punctuation and blanks.

countryCode.description: The standard code for the country from Part 1 of ISO 3166.

countrySubCode.description: The standard code for the country subdivision from Part 2 of ISO 3166.

PayeeRemittanceDeliveryMethod.description: The method by which the remittance advice is delivered. This is used when the remittance is separate from the payment.

name.description: The name of the third party processor, if required, that would be the first recipient of the remittance.

ftp.description: Information for file transfer deliveries, such as SFTP, FTP, or FTPS.

onLine.description: The web address of the online portal for secure hosted or other electronic delivery. The URL is typically provided without the scheme and separator. For example, `stedi.com`.

Payer.description: Information about the payer providing the benefits information. The response will always include the payer's business name and an identifier, such as the payer's tax ID. Most payers also include contact information.

entityIdentifier.description: The entity identifier code for the payer. Can be `2B` - Third-Party Administrator, `36` - Employer, `GP` - Gateway Provider, `P5` Plan Sponsor, or `PR` - Payer.

entityType.description: The entity type qualifier for the payer. Can be set to `1` - Person (not commonly used) or `2` - Non-Person Entity (most common).

firstName.description: The payer's first name, when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

lastName.description: The payer's last name. Used when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

name.description: The payer's business name, when the payer is not a person.

middleName.description: The payer's middle name or initial, when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

suffix.description: The payer's name suffix, such as Jr. or III. Used when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

employersId.description: Deprecated; The payer's identification number for the entity receiving the benefits information.

federalTaxpayersIdNumber.description: The payer's federal taxpayer's identification number.

naic.description: The payer's National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) identification number.

npi.description: The payer's National Provider Identifier (NPI).

centersForMedicareAndMedicaidPlanId.description: The payer's Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services PlanID.

aaaErrors.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more `AAA` errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. Common reasons for rejection at the `payer` level include issues with payer enrollment and that the payer's system is down or experiencing issues. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

etin.description: The payer's Electronic Transmitter Identification Number (ETIN).

contactName.description: The name of the contact person or entity.

contactMethods.description: Each contact will have a single property set, except for phone with extension.

stediId.description: A unique ID that Stedi assigned to this payer and uses internally for routing requests. This ID will not change even if the `primaryPayerId` is updated.

displayName.description: The payer's business name, such as Cigna or Aetna. This is the name most commonly used to identify the payer.

primaryPayerId.description: The most commonly used ID for a payer. This value often corresponds to the name the payer uses internally and provides to patients on member ID cards.

aliases.description: Alternative IDs associated with a payer. If a payer changes their `primaryPayerId`, aliases allow you to continue sending transactions to the payer using the old ID uninterrupted.

names.description: Alternative names associated with a payer. These additional names help you search for and identify payers using the name most familiar to your organization.

PaymentInfo.description: Information relevant to the claim and claim payment, including the subscriber, providers, and service lines.

claimStatementPeriodStart.description: The claim period start date, expressed as YYYYMMDD. If the claim statement period start date is conveyed without a subsequent claim statement period end date, the end date is assumed to be the same as the start date.

claimStatementPeriodEnd.description: The claim period end date, expressed as YYYYMMDD.

coverageExpirationDate.description: The expiration date of the patient's coverage, expressed as YYYYMMDD.

claimReceivedDate.description: The date the claim was received by the payer, expressed as YYYYMMDD.

claimAdjustments.description: Any adjustments made to the claim payment and the reasons for those adjustments.

claimContactInformation.description: The person or office that handles communications about the claim.

serviceLines.description: Information about specific service lines in the claim.

PaymentInfoClaimPaymentInfo.description: Information about the claim status, charge amounts, and patient responsibility amount.

patientControlNumber.description: The patient control number provided in the original claim. You can use this value to correlate the payer's response with the original claim.

claimStatusCode.description: The status of the claim. For example, `1` - Processed as Primary. Visit `CLP02` in the [Health Care Claim Payment/Advice specification](https://www.stedi.com/app/guides/view/hipaa/health-care-claim-paymentadvice-x221a1/01GRYB6DS30MGXWBPFZCM3695E#properties.detail.properties.header_number_LX_loop.items.properties.claim_payment_information_CLP_loop.items.properties.claim_payment_information_CLP.properties.claim_status_code_02) for a complete list and usage notes.

totalClaimChargeAmount.description: The total amount of submitted charges for this claim, expressed as a decimal. This can be positive, zero, or negative. For example, this may contain a negative charge for a reversal claim.

claimPaymentAmount.description: The total amount of the claim payment, expressed as a decimal. This value can be positive, zero, or negative.

patientResponsibilityAmount.description: The amount the patient is responsible for paying. This can include the deductible, non-covered services, co-pay, and co-insurance. This is not used for reversals.

claimFilingIndicatorCode.description: A code identifying the type of claim. For example `DS` - Disability. Visit `CLP06` in the [Health Care Claim Payment/Advice specification](https://www.stedi.com/app/guides/view/hipaa/health-care-claim-paymentadvice-x221a1/01GRYB6DS30MGXWBPFZCM3695E#properties.detail.properties.header_number_LX_loop.items.properties.claim_payment_information_CLP_loop.items.properties.claim_payment_information_CLP.properties.claim_filing_indicator_code_06) for a complete list and usage notes.

payerClaimControlNumber.description: The payer's internal control number for the claim.

facilityTypeCode.description: A code identifying where services were or may be performed. This is the [Place of Service Codes](https://www.cms.gov/medicare/coding-billing/place-of-service-codes/code-sets) for Professional or Dental Services.

claimFrequencyCode.description: A code identifying the frequency of the claim. It matches what the payer received in the original claim. Visit [Bill Type Frequency Codes](https://www.nubc.org/system/files/media/file/2019/06/billTypeFrequencyCodes837.pdf) for a complete list and definitions.

diagnosisRelatedGroupDRGCode.description: Code indicating a patient's diagnosis group based on their medical symptoms.

PaymentInfoClaimSupplementalInformation.description: Additional information about the claim payment. All values are expressed as decimals.

coverageAmount.description: The total covered charges. This is the sum of the original submitted provider charges that are considered for payment under the health plan. This excludes charges considered not covered, but includes reductions to payments of covered services, such as patient deductibles.

discountAmount.description: This is the Prompt Pay Discount Amount.

patientAmountPaid.description: The amount the patient has already paid.

negativeLedgerBalance.description: The negative ledger balance. Only used by Medicare Part A and Medicare Part B.

totalClaimBeforeTaxes.description: The total claim amount before taxes.

federalMedicareOrMedicaidPaymentMandateC.description: Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 1.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 2.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 3.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 4.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 5.

PaymentInfoClaimSupplementalInformationQ.description: Additional quantity information about the claim payment. All values are expressed as decimals.

coInsuredActual.description: The actual amount of co-insurance designated by the health plan.

notReplacedBloodUnits.description: The number of non-replaced blood units.

federalMedicareOrMedicaidPaymentMandateC.description: Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 1.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 2.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 3.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 4.
Federal Medicare or Medicaid Payment Mandate - Category 5.

PaymentInfoCorrectedPatientOrInsuredName.description: Used to provide corrected information about the insured.

organizationName.description: The business name of the insured when they are not an individual.

lastName.description: The insured's last name.

firstName.description: The insured's first name.

middleName.description: The insured's middle name or initial of the insured.

suffix.description: The insured's name suffix, such as Jr. or III.

insuredsChangedUniqueIdentificationNumbe.description: The insured's changed unique identification number.

PaymentInfoInpatientAdjudication.description: Information about the adjudication of inpatient claims.

coveredDaysOrVisitsCount.description: The number of days or visits covered by the health plan.

ppsOperatingOutlierAmount.description: The Prospective Payment System (PPS) Operating Outlier amount, expressed as a decimal.

lifetimePsychiatricDaysCount.description: The number of psychiatric days for the patient's lifetime.

claimMSPPassThroughAmount.description: The Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) pass-through amount.

claimPPSCapitalAmount.description: The total Prospective Payment System (PPS) capital amount.

ppsCapitalFSPDRGAmount.description: The Prospective Payment System (PPS) capital, federal specific portion, Diagnosis Related Group (DRG) amount.

ppsCapitalHSPDRGAmount.description: The Prospective Payment System (PPS) capital, hospital specific portion, Diagnosis Related Group (DRG), amount.

ppsCapitalDSHDRGAmount.description: The Prospective Payment System (PPS) capital, disproportionate share, hospital Diagnosis Related Group (DRG) amount.

ppsCapitalIMEAmount.description: The Prospective Payment System (PPS) capital indirect medical education claim amount.

ppsOperatingHospitalSpecificDRGAmount.description: The hospital specific Diagnosis Related Group (DRG) Amount.

costReportDayCount.description: The number of cost report days.

ppsOperatingFederalSpecificDRGAmount.description: The federal specific Diagnosis Related Group (DRG) amount.

claimPPSCapitalOutlierAmount.description: The Prospective Payment System (PPS) Capital Outlier amount.

nonPayableProfessionalComponentAmount.description: The professional component amount billed but not payable.

PaymentInfoOtherClaimRelatedIdentificati.description: Additional reference numbers to identify the specific claim.

groupOrPolicyNumber.description: The group or policy number for the health plan.

memberIdentificationNumber.description: The health plan member identification number.

adjustedRePricedClaimReferenceNumber.description: The adjusted repriced claim reference number.

authorizationNumber.description: An authorization number assigned by the adjudication process that was not provided prior to the services.

originalReferenceNumber.description: The reference number for the original claim. This is included for correction claims.

predeterminationOfBenefitsIdentification.description: The predetermination of benefits identification number.

ssn.description: The social security number (SSN).

PaymentInfoOutpatientAdjudication.description: Information about the adjudication of claims not related to an inpatient setting.

reimbursementRate.description: The reimbursement rate, expressed as a decimal.

claimHCPCSPayableAmount.description: The claim Health Care Financing Administration Common Procedural Coding System (HCPCS) payable amount, expressed as a decimal.

claimESRDPaymentAmount.description: The End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) payment amount.

nonPayableProfessionalComponentAmount.description: The professional component amount billed but not payable.

PaymentInfoPatientName.description: Information about the individual who received medical services.

lastName.description: The patient's last name.

firstName.description: The patient's first name.

middleName.description: The patient's middle name or initial.

suffix.description: The patient's name suffix, such as Jr or III.

ssn.description: The patient's Social Security Number (SSN).

healthInsuranceClaimNumber.description: The patient's Health Insurance Claim (HIC) Number.

memberId.description: The patient's member ID number for their health plan.

medicaidRecipientIdentificationNumber.description: The patient's Medicaid Recipient Identification Number.

PaymentInfoRenderingProvider.description: Information about the provider who rendered the services.

organizationName.description: The rendering provider's business name.

lastName.description: The rendering provider's last name.

firstName.description: The rendering provider's first name.

middleName.description: The rendering provider's middle name or initial.

suffix.description: The rendering provider's name suffix, such as Jr. or III.

blueCrossProviderNumber.description: The rendering provider's Blue Cross Provider Number.

blueShieldProviderNumber.description: The rendering provider's Blue Shield Provider Number.

taxId.description: The rendering provider's Federal Taxpayer Identification Number.

medicaidProviderNumber.description: The rendering provider's Medicare Provider Number.

providerCommercialNumber.description: The rendering provider's Provider Commercial Number.

stateLicenseNumber.description: The rendering provider's State License Number.

npi.description: The rendering provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI).

PaymentInfoRenderingProviderIdentificati.description: Additional identifiers for the rendering provider.

stateLicenseNumber.description: The rendering provider's State License Number.

blueCrossProviderNumber.description: The rendering provider's Blue Cross Provider Number.

blueShieldProviderNumber.description: The rendering provider's Blue Shield Provider Number.

medicareProviderNumber.description: The rendering provider's Medicare Provider Number.

medicaidProviderNumber.description: The rendering provider's Medicaid Provider Number.

champusIdentificationNumber.description: The rendering provider's CHAMPUS Identification Number.

facilityIdNumber.description: The rendering provider's Facility ID Number.

nationalCouncilForPrescriptionDrugProgra.description: The rendering provider's National Council for Prescription Drug Program Pharmacy Number.

providerCommercialNumber.description: The rendering provider's Provider Commercial Number.

PaymentInfoSubscriber.description: Information about the primary policyholder for the health plan. This may or may not be the patient.

organizationName.description: The subscriber's business name, if the subscriber is not an individual.

lastName.description: The subscriber's last name.

firstName.description: The subscriber's first name.

middleName.description: The subscriber's middle name or initial.

suffix.description: The subscriber's name suffix, such as Jr. or III.

taxId.description: The subscriber's Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number. Only used when the subscriber is a business entity and not an individual.

memberId.description: The subscriber's member ID for their health plan.

PlaceOfServiceCode.description: Code identifying the type of facility where the services were or may be performed.

PlanDateInformation.description:
Contains the dates associated with the subscriber's insurance plan. This information is used to determine the patient's eligibility for benefits.
- All dates are formatted as YYYYMMDD (for single dates) or as YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD (for date ranges).
- Properties contain a single date unless otherwise noted.
- The provided dates apply to every every benefit within the patient's health plan unless specifically noted within a `benefitsInformation.benefitsDateInformation` object.
- Most payers return either `plan` or `planBegin` and `planEnd`, but the exact dates returned depend on the payer's discretion and the patient's insurance plan.

plan.description: Can be formatted as a single date or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

eligibility.description: Can be formatted as a single date, or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

planBegin.description: Can be formatted as a single date, or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

admission.description: Formatted as YYYYMMDD (for single dates) or as YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD (for date ranges).

service.description: Can be formatted as a single date, or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

PlanInformation.description: Additional identification for the subscriber's healthcare plan.

memberId.description: The member identification number - only used when checking eligibility with a Workers' Compensation or Property and Casualty insurer.

alternativeListId.description: The alternative list ID - identifies a list of alternative drugs with the associated formulary status for the patient.

classOfContractCode.description: The class of contract code - used to identify the applicable class of contract for claims processing.

coverageListId.description: The coverage list ID - identifies a list of drugs that have coverage limitations for the patient.

contractNumber.description: The contract number of a contract between the payer and the provider that requested the eligibility check.

patientAccountNumber.description: The patient account number. If you included this value in the original eligibility request, the payer will return the same value here in the response.

idCardSerialNumber.description: The identification card serial number. The Identification Card Serial Number uniquely identifies the identification card when multiple cards have been or will be issued to a member, such as a replacement card.

idCardNumber.description: The identity card number, used when the Identity Card Number is different than the Member Identification Number.

centersForMedicareAndMedicaidServicesNPI.description: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) assigned by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

planNetworkIdDescription.description: The plan, group, or plan network name

agencyClaimNumber.description: The agency claim number, only used when the information source is a Property and Casualty payer.

PlanParticipationCode.description: Code indicating whether the provider accepts assignment. This refers to whether the provider accepts assignment and/or has a participation agreement with the destination payer. It does not indicate whether the patient has assigned benefits to the provider. Can be set to `A` - Assigned, `B` - Assignment Accepted on Clinical Lab Services Only, or `C` - Not Assigned. Choose `A` when the provider accepts assignment and/or has a participation agreement with the destination payer, OR the provider does not accept assignment and/or have a participation agreement, but is advising the payer to adjudicate this specific claim under the participating provider benefits allowed under certain plans.

predeterminationOfBenefits.description: The Predetermination of Benefits Identification Number. If you're including the identifier provided by the payer identified in `claimInformation.otherSubscriberInformation.otherPayerName`, you must also include the `otherPayerPrimaryIdentifier` property.

otherPayerPrimaryIdentifier.description: The primary identifier of the payer who assigned the `predeterminationOfBenefits` number. This must match the identifier in the `claimInformation.otherSubscriberInformation.otherPayerName.otherPayerIdentifier` property.

PregnancyIndicator.description: Code indicating whether the patient is pregnant. Can be set to `Y` - Yes.

PricingMethodologyCode.description: Code indicating the pricing or repricing methodology. Visit [Claims code lists](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/claims-code-lists#pricing-methodology-codes-2) for a complete list.

PrimaryIdentifierTypeCode.description: Code identifying the type of identifier. Can be set to `PI` - Payor Identification or `XV` - Centers for Medicare/Medicaid Services PlanID. Use code value `XV` when reporting Health Plan ID (HPID) or Other Entity Identifier (OEID).

principalDiagnosisCode.description: The principal diagnosis code for the patient. It must be a valid code from the appropriate coding system. **Do not** submit the decimal for ICD codes; the decimal is implied. Also, **do not** submit IDC-10 header codes. Header codes exist to group related codes and are not valid for billing. These header codes can change with each new version of ICD-10, so we recommend reviewing your diagnosis codes every year to ensure that they aren't classified as header codes in the most recent version. To determine whether a code is a header code, you can also search the [Value Set Authority Center](https://vsac.nlm.nih.gov/context/cs). If the 'Header' property is set, the code is a header code and you shouldn't use it in claim submissions.

PrincipalDiagnosisPresentOnAdmissionIndi.description: Indicates whether the principal diagnosis was present on admission. Can be set to `N` - No (onset did NOT occur prior to admission to the hospital), `Y` - Yes (onset occurred prior to admission to the hospital), `U` - Unknown, or `W` - Not Applicable.

PrincipalDiagnosisQualifierCode.description: Code identifying the type of diagnosis code used. Can be set to `ABK` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification Principal Diagnosis or `BK` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification (ICD-9-CM) Principal Diagnosis. Note that ICD-9 is deprecated and cannot be used in new claims.

principalProcedureCode.description: The principal procedure code for the patient. It must be a valid code from the appropriate coding system. **Do not** submit the decimal for ICD codes; the decimal is implied.

principalProcedureDate.description: The date when the procedure was performed, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

PrincipalProcedureInformationQualifierCo.description: Code identifying the type of procedure code used. Can be set to `BBR` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification (ICD-10-PCS) Principal Procedure Codes, `BR` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification (ICD-9-CM) Principal Procedure Codes, or `CAH` - Advanced Billing Concepts (ABC) Codes. Note that ICD-9 and ABC codes are deprecated and cannot be used in new claims.

otherPayerPrimaryIdentifier.description: This must match the value in `claimInformation.otherSubscriberInformation.otherPayerName.otherPayerIdentifier`.

ProcedureIdentifier.description: Code identifying the specific industry code list used for the `procedureCode`. Visit [Claims code lists](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/claims-code-lists#composite-medical-procedure-product-or-service-id-qualifier-codes) for a complete list.

ProductOrServiceIDQualifier.description: A code identifying the type/source of the descriptive number used in Product/Service ID. Visit [Check claim status](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/check-claim-status#product-or-service-id-qualifier) for a complete list.

procedureModifiers.description: A modifier code that clarifies or improves the reporting accuracy of the associated procedure code. If not required, do not send.

description.description: A free form description to clarify the procedure code and any procedure modifiers, as needed.

lineItemChargeAmount.description: The total charge amount for the service, including the provider's base charge and any applicable tax or postage. It is acceptable to set this to `0` (zero).

serviceUnitCount.description: The number of units of the service provided, formatted as a decimal.

placeOfServiceCode.description: A code identifying the location where services were rendered. Visit [Place of Service Codes](https://www.cms.gov/medicare/coding-billing/place-of-service-codes/code-sets) for a complete list.

ProsthesisCrownOrInlayCode.description: Code indicating the placement status for the dental work. Can be set to `I` - Initial Placement or `R` - Replacement. When set to `R`, you must include either the `priorPlacementDate` or `estimatedPriorPlacementDate` properties within the `claimInformation.serviceLines.serviceLineDateInformation` object.

Provider.description:
Information about the entity requesting the eligibility check. This may be an individual practitioner, a medical group, a hospital, or another type of healthcare provider. 
 - You must provide the `organizationName` (if the entity is an organization), or `firstName` and `lastName` (if the provider is an individual). 
 - You must also provide an identifier - this is typically the provider's National Provider ID (`npi`). If the provider doesn't have an NPI, you can supply their `taxId` or `ssn`.
 - You shouldn't include additional properties, such as `taxId` or `address`, unless they are specifically required or suggested by the payer.

organizationName.description: The provider's business name. This property is required if the provider is not a person.

firstName.description: The provider's first name. This property is required if the provider is an individual.

lastName.description: The provider's last name. This property is required if the provider is an individual.

npi.description: The provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI). This identifier is required for all healthcare providers who are eligible to receive an NPI. Some non-traditional providers such as transportation services, durable medical equipment (DME) suppliers, or alternative medicine practitioners are not eligible to receive an NPI. If the provider doesn't have an NPI, you can supply either their `taxId` or `ssn`.

serviceProviderNumber.description: The provider's service provider number. Only include when the provider doesn't have an NPI. This is typically when the provider is a non-medical provider, such as a social worker, home health aide, or transportation service.

payorId.description: Only used for payer-to-payer transactions, which are not currently supported. Do not use.

taxId.description: The provider's Federal Taxpayer Identification Number (also known as an EIN).

ssn.description:
The provider's Social Security Number (SSN).
    - Only include when the provider doesn't have an NPI. This is typically when the provider is a non-medical provider, such as a social worker, home health aide, or transportation service.
    - Don't use this for Federally-administered programs, such as Medicare.

pharmacyProcessorNumber.description: The provider's pharmacy processor number. Only include when the provider doesn't have an NPI. This is typically when the provider is a non-medical provider, such as a social worker, home health aide, or transportation service.

employersId.description:
Deprecated; The submitter's Employer's Identification Number (EIN). Only use when an employer is checking the eligibility and benefits of their employees.
This shape is deprecated: This property is no longer used.

referenceIdentification.description: The provider's [Taxonomy Code](https://x12.org/codes/provider-taxonomy-codes). Only used when the provider's taxonomy code is relevant to the eligibility/benefit inquiry. For example, an institutional provider such as a hospital may need to use a taxonomy code to specify a specific unit or department.

stateLicenceNumber.description: The provider's state license number. If you include this information, you must also include the `informationReceiverAdditionalIdentifierState`.

facilityIdNumber.description: The ID number for the provider's facility.

devicePinNumber.description: The provider's electronic device pin number.

providerPlanNetworkIdNumber.description: The provider's plan network identification number.

facilityNetworkIdNumber.description: The provider's facility network identification number.

informationReceiverAdditionalIdentifierS.description: The two-character state ID of the state that assigned the `stateLicenseNumber`.

address.description: The address of the provider requesting the information. This is required when the provider has multiple locations and you need to identify the specific location making the request. You must include at least the `address1` and `city` properties in this object.

fiscalPeriodDate.description: The last day of the provider's fiscal year, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

adjustments.description: Information about the adjustments, if applicable.

statusInformationEffectiveDate.description: The date the claim status information is effective.

providerStatuses.description: The status of the entire claim.

referenceIdentification.description: The provider's taxonomy code. Can be `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, or `SU` - Supervising.

ProviderProviderCode.description:
Communicate the provider's role in the type of benefits specified in the request. For example, you could set this to `RF` if the provider is also the referring provider. 

 You can use one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising

healthCareClaimStatusCategoryCode.description: Code indicating the industry list that contains the `statusCode`.

entityIdentifierCode.description: Code indicating the entity that the status is related to.

ProviderSummaryInformation.description: Summary information about the provider, including the provider's identifier, where the services were performed, and total claim charge amounts.

facilityTypeCode.description: A code identifying the type of facility where services were performed. This is the [Place of Service Codes](https://www.cms.gov/medicare/coding-billing/place-of-service-codes/code-sets) for Professional or Dental Services.

fiscalPeriodDate.description: The last day of the provider's fiscal year, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

totalClaimChargeAmount.description: The total of the charges reported for all claims, expressed as a decimal.

totalMSPPayerAmount.description: The total Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) primary payer amount, expressed as a decimal.

totalNonLabChargeAmount.description: The total of non-laboratory charges, expressed as a decimal.

totalHCPCSReportedChargeAmount.description: The total of the charges reported for all Health Care Financing Administration Common Procedural Coding System (HCPCS) codes, expressed as a decimal.

totalHCPCSPayableAmount.description: The total of the charges reported for all HCPCS codes that are payable, expressed as a decimal.

totalProfessionalComponentAmount.description: The total of the professional component charges, expressed as a decimal.

totalMSPPatientLiabilityMetAmount.description: The total Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) patient liability met, expressed as a decimal.

totalPatientReimbursementAmount.description: The total patient reimbursement amount, expressed as a decimal.

totalPIPClaimCount.description: The total periodic interim payment (PIP) number of claims, expressed as a decimal.

totalPIPAdjustmentAmount.description: The total periodic interim payment (PIP) adjustment amount, expressed as a decimal.

ProviderSupplementalSummaryInformation.description: Additional summary information about the provider and the charges in the claim. All values are expressed as decimals.

totalDRGAmount.description: The total of the charges reported for all diagnosis-related group (DRG) codes.

totalCapitalAmount.description: The total capital amount. This includes: capital federal-specfic amount, hospital federal-specfic amount, hold harmless amount, Indirect Medical Education amount, Disproportionate Share Hospital amount, and the exception amount. It does not include any capital outlier amount.

totalIndirectMedicalEducationAmount.description: The total indirect medical education amount.

totalOutlierDayCount.description: The total number of outlier days.

averageDRGLengthOfStay.description: The average length of stay for diagnosis related group (DRG) claims.

totalCostReportDayCount.description: The total number of cost report days.

totalCoveredDayCount.description: The total number of covered days.

totalNonCoveredDayCount.description: The total number of non-covered days.

totalMSPPassThroughAmount.description: The total Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) pass-through amount, calculated for a non-Medicare payer.

totalPPSCapitalFSPDRGAmount.description: The total prospective payment system (PPS) capital, federal-specific portion, diagnosis-related group (DRG) amount.

totalPPSCapitalHSPDRGAmount.description: The total prospective payment system (PPS) capital, hospital-specific portion, diagnosis-related group (DRG) amount.

totalPPSDSHDRGAmount.description: The total prospective payment system (PPS) disproportionate share, hospital diagnosis-related group (DRG) amount.

PurchasedServiceInformation.description: Specify information about services that were purchased. Required on non-vision service lines when adjudication is known to be impacted by the charge amount for services purchased from another source OR when adjudication is known to be impacted by the acquisition cost of lenses.

purchasedServiceProviderIdentifier.description: This must be the same identifier you provided within `claimInformation.serviceLines.purchasedServiceProvider`.

purchasedServiceChargeAmount.description: The cost of the purchased service.

QuestionResponseCode.description: Code indicating a yes or no condition response to the question. Can be set to `N` - No, `W` - Not Applicable, or `Y` - Yes.

Receiver.description: The entity responsible for the payment of the claim, such as an insurance company or government agency.

organizationName.description: The business name of the payer receiving the claim, such as Aetna or Cigna.

ReceiverAccountDetails.description: The provider's financial institution account details.

receiverDfiIdNumberQualifier.description: The code identifying the type of identification number of the Depository Financial Institution (DFI). Can be either `01` - ABA Transit Routing Number Including Check Digits (9 digits) or `04` - Canadian Bank Branch Institution Number.

receiverAccountNumberQualifier.description: The code identifying the type of account. Can be either `DA` - Demand Deposit or `SA` - Savings.

qualifier.description: The code identifying the type of reference number.

otherIdentifier.description: The identifier for the other payer who provided this reference number. This is only required when the reference number is provided by the non-destination payer. The value must match the `otherPayerName.otherPayerIdentifier` property.

Referring.description: Information about the provider who directed the patient to the rendering provider for care. For example, a primary care physician may refer patients to a specialist. Use when the referring provider applies to the entire claim, not just a specific service line.

npi.description: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) assigned to the provider.

providerUpinNumber.description:
Deprecated; do not use.
This shape is deprecated.

taxonomyCode.description: Code from the National Uniform Claims Committee [Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set](https://taxonomy.nucc.org/). This identifies the provider's type and/or area of specialty.

firstName.description: The provider's first name, if the provider is an individual.

lastName.description: The provider's last name, if the provider is an individual.

middleName.description: The provider's middle name or initial, if the provider is an individual.

suffix.description: The provider's name suffix, such as Jr. or III.

organizationName.description: The provider's business name.

ReferringSecondaryIdentificationQualifie.description: The type of identifier used in `secondaryIdentifier`. Can be set to `0B` - State License Number, `1G` - Provider UPIN Number, or `G2` - Provider Commercial Number. Note that UPIN is deprecated and should not be used.

RelationshipToSubscriberCode.description: Identifies the relationship of the patient to the subscriber. Can be set to `01` - Spouse, `19` - Child, `20` - Employee, `21` - Unknown, `39` - Organ Donor, `40` - Cadaver Donor, `53` - Life Partner, or `G8` - Other Relationship.

ReleaseInformationCode.description: Indicates whether the provider has on file a signed statement by the patient authorizing the release of medical data to other organizations. Can be set to `Y` - Yes, or `I` - Informed Consent to Release Medical Information for Conditions or Diagnoses Regulated by Federal Statues. Use `I` when the provider has not collected a signature AND state or federal laws do not require a signature be collected.

ReleaseOfInformationCode.description: Code indicating whether the provider has on file a signed statement by the patient authorizing the release of medical data to other organizations. Can be set to `I` - Informed Consent to Release Medical Information or `Y` - Yes. Code `I` is required when the provider has not collected a signature AND state or federal laws do not require a signature be collected. Code `Y` is required when the provider has collected a signature OR when state or federal laws require a signature be collected.

Rendering.description: Information about the person or company (laboratory or other facility) who rendered the care. Use this object for all types of rendering providers including laboratories. When a substitute provider (locum tenens) was used, enter that provider's information here. Use when the provider applies to the entire claim, not just a specific service line.

npi.description: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) assigned to the provider.

providerUpinNumber.description:
Deprecated; do not use.
This shape is deprecated.

taxonomyCode.description: Code from the National Uniform Claims Committee [Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set](https://taxonomy.nucc.org/). This identifies the provider's type and/or area of specialty.

firstName.description: The provider's first name, if the provider is an individual.

lastName.description: The provider's last name, if the provider is an individual. You must include either the `lastName` or `organizationName` property in this object.

middleName.description: The provider's middle name or initial, if the provider is an individual.

suffix.description: The provider's name suffix, such as Jr. or III.

organizationName.description: The provider's business name, if the provider is an organization. You must include either the `lastName` or `organizationName` property in this object.

RenderingSecondaryIdentificationQualifie.description: The type of identifier used in `secondaryIdentifier`. Can be set to `0B` - State License Number, `1G` - Provider UPIN Number, `G2` - Provider Commercial Number, or `LU` - Location Number. Note that UPIN is deprecated and should not be used.

ReportInformation.description: Required when there is a paper attachment following this claim, when attachments are sent electronically with the claim, or when the provider deems it necessary to identify additional information that is being held at the provider's office and is available upon request.

attachmentControlNumber.description: The control number assigned to the attachment.

ReportInformationAttachmentReportTypeCod.description: Code indicating the title or contents of a document, report or supporting item. For example, `08` - Plan of Treatment or `CT` - Certification. Visit [Claims code lists](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/claims-code-lists#attachment-report-type-codes) for a complete list.

ReportInformationAttachmentTransmissionC.description: Code identifying the method by which the provider's report is attached. Can be set to `AA` - Available on Request at Provider Site, `BM` - By Mail, `EL` - Electronically Only, `EM` - E-Mail, `FT` - File Transfer, or `FX` - By Fax.

controlNumber.description: The control number the the payer provided in the claim status response. This is used to identify the transaction.

referenceIdentification.description: A number the payer assigns to the transaction to identify it within their system.

transactionSetCreationDate.description: The date the payer created the transaction, expressed as YYYYMMDD.

transactionSetCreationTime.description: The time the payer created the transaction, expressed in 24-hour clock time. May be formatted as HHMM, HHMMSS, HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99).

payers.description: Information about the payer and the claim status transactions included in the response.

serviceLines.description: Information about specific services within a claim. This object is only included in the 277CA when the claim is rejected because of errors with the service line information provided.

contactName.description: The name of the contact person or entity.

RepricedApprovedServiceUnitCode.description: The approved service units or inpatient days. Can be set to `DA` - Days or `UN` - Unit.

birthSequenceNumber.description: The number assigned to each family member born with the same birth date, such as twins or triplets. Use to indicate the birth order when there are multiple births associated with the provided birth date.

issueNumber.description: The issue number for the dependent's insurance policy.

eligibilityCategory.description: The eligibility category for the dependent.

memberId.description: Only use for property and casualty use cases when the property and casualty patient identifier is a member ID and would be used in an 837 healthcare claim submission.

firstName.description: The dependent's first name. Can be 0-35 alphanumeric characters.

middleName.description: The dependent's middle name or middle initial. Can be 0-25 alphanumeric characters.

lastName.description: The dependent's last name. Can be 0-60 alphanumeric characters.

suffix.description: The dependent's name suffix, such as Sr. or III. Can be 0-10 alphanumeric characters.

dateOfBirth.description: The dependent's date of birth (DOB) in YYYYMMDD format. We **strongly recommend** including the DOB in your request. Many payers need this information to identify the patient in their system and will immediately return an error when it's not provided.

ssn.description: The dependent's social security number. Can be 0-50 alphanumeric characters. Don't use this for Federally-administered programs, such as Medicare.

groupNumber.description: The group number for the dependent's insurance plan. Can be 0-50 alphanumeric characters.

providerIdentifier.description: The provider identifier you specified in the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` property. For example, the provider's National Provider ID or Federal Taxpayer Identification number. If you set the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` to `PXC`, then this property should contain the provider's taxonomy code.

beginningCardIssueDate.description:
Deprecated; The date the insurance card was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.
This shape is deprecated: This property is no longer used.

endCardIssueDate.description:
Deprecated; The date the insurance card expires, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.
This shape is deprecated: This property is no longer used.

idCardIssueDate.description:
Deprecated; The date the identification card was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.
This shape is deprecated: This property is no longer used.

planIssueDate.description:

RequestDependentProviderCode.description:
Use this for providers that are not requesting the eligibility check - the requestor is specified in the `provider` object. For example, if you are a hospital making an eligibility request, this is where you would specify information about a referring provider's role. 

 You can use one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE`- Performing, `R`- Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising

RequestDependentReferenceIdentificationQ.description:
The type of `providerIdentifier` you are using. Use for providers that are not requesting the eligiblity check, such as the referring provider.
- Set to `HPI` when the National Provider ID is mandated for use.
- Set to `PXC` if you're identifying a type of specialty associated with services provided to the dependent. 
 
 Otherwise, you can set to the following: `9K` - Servicer, `D3` - National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy Number, `EI` - Employer's Identification Number, `HPI` - Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services National Provider Identifier, `PXC` - Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code, `SY` - Social Security Number, `TJ` - Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number

RequestSubscriber.description:
The primary policyholder for the insurance plan _or_ a dependent with a unique member ID. If a dependent has a unique member ID, include their information here and leave `dependents` empty.
- At a minimum, our API requires that you supply at least one of these fields in the request: `memberId`, `dateOfBirth`, or `lastName`. However, each payer has different requirements, so you should supply the fields necessary for each payer to identify the subscriber in their system.
- When you provide all four of `memberId`, `dateOfBirth`, `firstName`, and `lastName`, payers are required to return a response if the member is in their database. Some payers may be able to search with less information, but this varies by payer.
- We recommend always including the patient's member ID when possible.

birthSequenceNumber.description: The number assigned to each family member born with the same birth date, such as twins or triplets. Use to indicate the birth order when there are multiple births associated with the provided birth date.

caseNumber.description: The case number associated with the subscriber.

medicaidRecipientIdentificationNumber.description: The Medicaid Recipient Identification Number. You can provide this number to identify the subscriber when it is the primary number the payer knows a member by (such as for Medicare or Medicaid). Do not supply this value unless it is different from the `memberId`.

spendDownAmount.description: Identify the dollar amount the subscriber will apply toward their spend down amount, if required. For some Medicaid programs, individuals must pay a certain amount towards their healthcare cost (spend down) before coverage starts.

spendDownTotalBilledAmount.description: The subscriber's spend down total billed amount.

coverageLevelCode.description: This property is no longer used.

memberId.description: The member ID for the subscriber's insurance policy.

firstName.description: The patient's first name. Can be 0-35 alphanumeric characters.

middleName.description: The patient's middle name or middle initial. Can be 0-25 alphanumeric characters.

lastName.description: The subscriber's last name. Can be 0-60 alphanumeric characters.

suffix.description: The name suffix, such as Jr., Sr., or III. Can be 0-10 alphanumeric characters.

dateOfBirth.description: The subscriber's date of birth in YYYYMMDD format.

ssn.description: The subscriber's Social Security Number (SSN). Many commercial and government payers ignore this property due to concerns about member privacy. However, some Medicaid programs support alternative searches using the patient's Social Security Number, instead of the member ID.

groupNumber.description: The group number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

idCard.description: The subscriber's identification card number. Include this property when this number is different than the subscriber's member ID. This is common in Medicaid.

providerIdentifier.description: The provider identifier you specified in the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` property. For example, the provider's National Provider ID or Federal Taxpayer Identification number. If you set the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` to `PXC`, then this property should contain the provider's taxonomy code.

Every claim must include this information in either the `subscriber` (when the patient is the subscriber) or `dependent` (when the patient is a dependent) object. You must include at least the `address1` and `city` properties in this object.

address1.description: The first line of the street address. This typically contains the building number and street name.

address2.description: The second line of the street address. This typically contains the apartment or suite number.

state.description: The state or province code. Only required when the city is in the Unites States and Canada.

postalCode.description: The postal zone or zip code. Exclude punctuation and spaces.

countryCode.description: Use the alpha-2 country codes from Part 1 of ISO 3166.

countrySubDivisionCode.description: Use the country subdivision codes from Part 2 of ISO 3166.

Use this for providers that are not requesting the eligibility check - the requestor is specified in the `provider` object. For example, if you are a hospital making an eligibility request, this is where you would specify information about a referring provider's role. 
 
 You can use one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising

- Set to `HPI` when the National Provider ID is mandated for use.
- Set to `PXC` if you're identifying a type of specialty associated with services provided to the subscriber. 
 
 Otherwise, you can set to the following: `9K` - Servicer, `D3` - National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy Number, `EI` - Employer's Identification Number, `HPI` - Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services National Provider Identifier, `PXC` - Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code, `SY - Social Security Number, `TJ` - Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number

ResourceNotFoundExceptionResponseContent.description:
//// Errors
The server response when the specified resource cannot be found after an API request passes authentication and authorization.

ResponseDependent.description: Information about the dependent listed in the original eligibility check request. Note that a dependent submitted in the request may be returned in the subscriber object. When present, this object will always include the dependent's name for identification, but many payers will also return the date of birth and other identifying information.

memberId.description: The member ID for the subscriber's insurance policy.

firstName.description: The dependent's first name.

lastName.description: The dependent's last name.

middleName.description: The dependent's middle name or initial.

suffix.description: The name suffix, such as Jr., Sr., or III.

entityIdentifier.description: The entity identifier for the dependent. It is always `03` - Dependent.

entityType.description: The entity type for the dependent. It can technically be set to `Person` or `Non-Person Entity`. In practice, our customers only receive `Person`.

dateOfBirth.description: The dependent's date of birth, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

informationStatusCode.description: The status of the dependent's information, used to report military service data. Can be `A` - Partial, `C` - Current, `L` - Latest, `O` - Oldest, `P` - Prior, `S` - Second Most Current, or `T` - Third Most Current.

employmentStatusCode.description: The dependent's employment status code, used to report military service data. Can be `AE` - Active Reserve, `AO` - Active Military - Overseas, `AS` - Academy Student, `AT` - Presidential Appointee, `AU` - Active Military - USA, `CC` - Contractor, `DD` - Dishonorably Discharged, `HD` - Honorably Discharged, `IR` - Inactive Reserves, `LX` - Leave of Absence: Military, `PE` - Plan to Enlist, `RE` - Recommissioned, `RM` - Retired Military - Overseas, `RR`- Retired Without Recall, or `RU` - Retired Military - USA.

governmentServiceAffiliationCode.description: The dependent's government service affiliation code, used to report military service data. Can be `A` - Air Force, `B` - Air Force Reserves, `C` - Army, `D` - Army Reserves, `E` - Coast Guard, `F` - Marine Corps, `G` - Marine Corps Reserves, `H` - National Guard, `I` - Navy, `J` - Navy Reserves, `K` - Other, `L`- Peace Corp, `M` - Regular Armed Forces, `N` - Reserves, `O` - U.S. Public Health Service, `Q` - Foreign Military, `R` - American Red Cross, `S` - Department of Defense, `U` - United States Organization, `W` - Military Sealift Command.

description.description: Context that identifies the exact military unit. Used to report military service data.

militaryServiceRankCode.description: The dependent's military service rank code. Can be `A1` - Admiral, `A2` - Airman, `A3` - Airman First Class, `B1` - Basic Airman, `B2` - Brigadier General, `C1` - Captain, `C2` - Chief Master Sergeant, `C3` - Chief Petty Officer, `C4` - Chief Warrant, `C5` - Colonel, `C6` - Commander, `C7` - Commodore, `C8` - Corporal, `C9` - Corporal Specialist 4, `E1` - Ensign, `F1` - First Lieutenant, `F2` - First Sergeant, `F3` - First Sergeant-Master Sergeant, `F4` - Fleet Admiral, `G1` - General, `G4` - Gunnery Sergeant, `L1` - Lance Corporal, `L2` - Lieutenant, `L3` - Lieutenant Colonel, `L4` - Lieutenant Commander, `L5` - Lieutenant General, `L6` - Lieutenant Junior Grade, `M1` - Major, `M2` - Major General, `M3` - Master Chief Petty Officer, `M4` - Master Gunnery Sergeant Major, `M5` - Master Sergeant, `M6` - Master Sergeant Specialist 8, `P1` - Petty Officer First Class, `P2` - Petty Officer Second Class, `P3` - Petty Officer Third Class, `P4` - Private, `P5` - Private First Class, `R1` - Rear Admiral, `R2` - Recruit, `S1` - Seaman, `S2` - Seaman Apprentice, `S3` - Seaman Recruit, `S4` - Second Lieutenant, `S5` - Senior Chief Petty Officer, `S6` - Senior Master Sergeant, `S7` - Sergeant, `S8` - Sergeant First Class Specialist 7, `S9` - Sergeant Major Specialist 9, `SA` - Sergeant Specialist 5, `SB` - Staff Sergeant, `SC` - Staff Sergeant Specialist 6, `T1` - Technical Sergeant, `V1` - Vice Admiral, `W1` - Warrant Officer.

dateTimePeriodFormatQualifier.description: The format of the military service date and time period. Can be set to `D8` - Date or `RD8` - Range of Dates.

dateTimePeriod.description: The military service date, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

startDateTimePeriod.description: The military service start date, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

endDateTimePeriod.description: The military service end date, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

ssn.description: The dependent's Social Security Number (SSN).

groupNumber.description: The group number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

planNumber.description: The plan number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

planNetworkIdNumber.description: The network identification number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

relationToSubscriber.description: The name of the `relationToSubscriberCode`. For example, `Child` when the code is `19`.

relationToSubscriberCode.description: For the dependent, this can be `01` - Spouse, `19` - Child, `20` Employee, `21` - Unknown, `39` - Organ Donor, `40` - Cadaver Donor, `53` - Life Partner, or `G8` - Other Relationship.

insuredIndicator.description: Indicates the status of the insured. For the dependent, this is always `N`.

maintenanceTypeCode.description: The maintenance type code. Used to acknowledge a change in the identifying elements for the dependent from those submitted in the original eligibility check request. It can also be included when the payer used the birth sequence number from the original request to locate the dependent in their system. This is always `001` - Change.

maintenanceReasonCode.description: Code identifying the reason for the changes to dependent identifying information, such as name, date of birth, or address. This is always `25` - Change in Identifying Data Elements.

birthSequenceNumber.description: The number assigned to each family member born with the same birth date, such as twins or triplets. Indicates the birth order when there are multiple births associated with the provided birth date.

aaaErrors.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more `AAA` errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

ResponseMemberGender.description: Code indiciating the patient's gender. Can be `F` - Female, `M` - Male, or `U` - Unknown.

submitterId.description: The submitter ID assigned to this request.

senderId.description: The sender ID assigned to this request.

billerId.description: The biller ID assigned to this request.

traceId.description: The file execution ID, a unique identifier assigned to the processed file within the Stedi platform.

applicationMode.description: Indicates where this request can be found for support.

ResponseProvider.description: Information about the entity that submitted the original eligibility check request. This may be an individual practitioner, a medical group, a hospital, or another type of healthcare provider. This object will always include at least one identifier, such as the provider's NPI, tax ID, or EIN.

providerName.description: The provider's last name. This applies to providers that are an individual.

providerFirstName.description: The provider's first name. This applies to providers that are an individual.

middleName.description: The provider's middle name. This applies to providers that are an individual.

suffix.description: The provider's name suffix, such as Jr., Sr., or III.

entityIdentifier.description: A code identifying the type of provider. Can be `Provider`, `Third-Party Administrator`, `Employer`, `Hospital`, `Facility`, `Gateway Provider`, `Plan Sponsor`, or `Payer`.

entityType.description: The type of entity. Can be `Person` or `Non-Person Entity`.

npi.description: The provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI).

providerCode.description:
A code that communicates the provider's role in the type of benefits information in the response. 
 
 Can be one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising.

serviceProviderNumber.description: The service provider number. This is an identification number assigned by the payer.

servicesPlanID.description: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) Plan ID.

address.description: The provider's contact information.

Common reasons for rejection at the `provider` level include missing or incorrect information and issues with the provider's NPI registration with the payer. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

ResponseSubscriber.description: Information about the primary policyholder for the insurance plan listed in the original eligibility check request. The response will always include either the subscriber's name or member ID for identification, but most payers will also return the subscriber's date of birth and other identifying information.

memberId.description: The member ID for the subscriber's insurance policy.

firstName.description: The subscriber's first name.

lastName.description: The subscriber's last name.

middleName.description: The subscriber's middle name or initial.

suffix.description: The name suffix, such as Jr., Sr., or III.

entityIdentifier.description: The entity identifier for the subscriber. This is always set to `IL` - Insured or Subscriber.

entityType.description: The entity type for the subscriber. It can technically be set to `Person` or `Non-Person Entity`. In practice, our customers only receive `Person`.

dateOfBirth.description: The subscriber's date of birth, formatted as YYYYMMDD.
